alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 1:29PM MST until August 07 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Areas including Snowflake and Taylor in Navajo County in north central Arizona... Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 430 PM MST. * At 126 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain southeast of Snowflake and Taylor. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Taylor, Shumway, Snowflake and White Mountain Lake. This includes the following highways... State Route 277 near mile marker 336. State Route 77 between mile markers 353 and 362. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Cheney Draw, Silver Creek, Hay Hollow Draw, Concho Flat Wash and Cottonwood Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
